page.title: 18CHURCH IN GILMORTON
page.content: There has been a church in Gilmorton since Saxon times and certain Saxon stonework has been incorporated into the tower. The church was rebuilt in 1861, the Saxon church having fallen into disrepair. The record of rectors starts in 1209. The church was enriched when Edmund Jackson was rector in the late 19th century. Much of the glass given then is by Kemp, as is the marble reredos of the Last Supper. The oldest gravestone is of Randolph Woodcock, dated 1708. There is a long record of churchwardens showing the predominant families in the village. The east gate in the churchyard was donated by the Bloxsons who were associated with Gilmorton from the 16th century to 1930.
